intro: Ruellia spinescens, commonly known as the spiked ruellia, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous growth habit. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically blue or purple in color, attracting pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees. Its leaves are opposite and often have a rough texture, and the stems are covered in fine spines, giving it its common name. Ruellia spinescens is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant blooms and adaptability to various growing conditions.
